results.title: The Shining
results.creator_credit: Producer Circle Company and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: In Stanley Kubrick’s chilling adaptation of a Stephen King horror novel, Jack Torrance, a struggling writer, accepts a job as caretaker of the Overlook Hotel, a luxurious but remote resort with a macabre history of violence. The hotel is closed for the winter, and Jack, his wife, Wendy, and son, Danny, will be the only residents for several snowy months. Jack hopes that the solitude will give him a chance to focus on his writing, but he soon spirals helplessly towards madness and murder as the hotel’s power plays upon his weaknesses. Cast includes: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Scatman Crothers and Danny Lloyd.

results.title: The Shillingbury blowers
results.creator_credit: Inner Circle Films, Greg Smith and Val Guest
results.brief_description: A tale about a quaint English village and its community Brass Band known as the Shillingbury Blowers led by its much loved conductor, Old Saltie (Trevor Howard). Tells of how this rather old-fashioned and conventional village is turned on its head when young pop musician Peter Higgins (Robin Nedwell) and his wife Sally (Diane Keen) move into town. Cast includes Jack Douglas, John Le Mesurier, Patrick Newell, Diane King. Music composed and conducted by Ed Welch.

results.title: The Sheltering sky
results.creator_credit: Sahara, TAO, Jeremy Thomas and Bernardo Bertolucci
results.brief_description: The exotic, erotic, epic film version of Paul Bowles’ celebrated novel, brought to life by one of the great masters of modern cinema, Bernardo Bertolucci. This is the extraordinary story of a husband and wife desperate to rekindle passion in their lives; daring to cross the border into a world where jealousy has no place, where sensuality knows no limits and where every fantasy is brought to light. Their journey will take them far from the civilised world into disaster and despair. Stars Debra Winger and John Malkovich.

results.title: The Sheik [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Famous Players-Lasky Corporation and George Melford
results.brief_description: The Sheik, released on 30th October 1921, has been credited with being the film that officially established the career of silent screen star Rudolph Valentino. Set in the exotic locale of the Saharan desert, it recounts the story of a tempestuous love affair between a young and powerful Sheik, Ahmed Ben Hassan and Lady Diana Mayo, a “defiant” English girl. Their first meeting sets the tone for what is to follow, with Diana recklessly sneaking inside an Arab-only casino in the guise of a dancer only to nearly end up being sold off at the marriage market. The mysterious and arrogant Ahmed immediately halts proceedings, and discovering her true identity, abruptly escorts her to the door. Irritated but intrigued by this brief encounter, Diana struggles to focus on her main goal, dismissed as “madcap” by horrified society women: to tour the Sahara desert alone, with only a native man, Mustapha Ali, for a guide. She soon realizes her folly when one day into her adventure she is spirited away by Ahmed and taken to his luxurious desert camp, where his amorous advances drive the despairing but feisty Englishwoman to plot an escape. However, she soon comes to the notice of Omair the bandit, who hatches a plot to steal her from his enemy. Ahmed, tortured by his love for Diana and overcome with guilt over his savage behaviour toward her, risks his life to liberate his one true love from Omair’s harem. Valentino later made a sequel, “Son of the sheik” (1926), the last film he completed before his untimely death. “The Sheik” is based on the sensational and exotic 1919 novel of the same name by E. M. Hull. Cast includes Rudolph Valentino as Sheik Ahmed Ben Hassan, Agnes Ayres as Lady Diana Mayo, Adolphe Menjou as Raoul de St. Hubert, Lucien Littlefield as Gaston, and Walter Long as Omair.

results.title: The Shearers
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Hugh Alexander
results.brief_description: Shearing teams are at work in different parts of Australia for most seasons of the year. This film tells the story of the shearers arriving at a typical sheep station and of their accommodation, the preparation of the various machines, combs and cutters - all of those things which must be attended to before the men begin work next morning.

results.title: The She-creature = The She creature
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Alex Gordon and Edward Cahn
results.brief_description: The lovely assistant of a mysterious and evil hypnotist has no idea that she is the descendent of a horrifying prehistoric sea monster, which she reverts back to when she is mesmerized by her boss. Unbeknownst to the hypnotist however, each time she is in the killer monster’s guise she becomes more skilled at controlling it. Immensely enjoyable 1950s ‘creature feature’ that boasts one of the most impressive monster costumes created in the B-Grade horror era. Cast includes Chester Morris and Marla English.
